title: 3D Gaussian Splatting for Real-Time Radiance Field Rendering
content:
3D Gaussian Splatting: Only a set of photos or a video is needed to quickly generate a 3D model.

Site: https://repo-sam.inria.fr/fungraph/3d-gaussian-splatting/
GitHub: https://github.com/graphdeco-inria/gaussian-splatting
License: Gaussian-Splatting License (free for non-commercial, research and evaluation)

And this 3D model not only looks real, but also easier and faster to make than other methods.

It uses a mathematical tool called “3D Gaussian function” to represent this 3D model, and finds a faster algorithm to render (i.e. generate) the 3D model. #gaussiansplatting

Easy to understand explanation:

Imagine you have a bunch of photos or videos and you want to see the scenes from a whole new perspective. 3D Gaussian Splatting is an advanced tool that allows you to do just that. It “recreates” these scenes in an exceptionally fast and high-quality manner, allowing you to view them from any angle as if you were actually standing there.

The “brain” of the tool uses a mathematical model called a 3D Gaussian that describes every detail of the scene with great precision. Even cooler, the tool also displays these new angles of the scene in real-time, meaning you don’t have to wait long to see the results.
